Caption: Mr. V. Srinivasan receives the President's Prize from Sir C.V. Raman
Description: The coveted President’s Prize (best academic record) was secured by Shri V. Srinivasan (B. Tech. in Mechanical Engineering – 5 years). He later went on to work briefly for Larsen & Tourbo, Mumbai before receiving his M.S. and Ph. D. in Industrial Administration from Carnegie-Mellon University, Pennsylvania. His area of expertise is Market Research and is most known for his research in ‘Conjoint Analysis’. He has been a consultant for a number of companies and won an innumerable number of awards including The Parlin Award and The Churchill Award. He is currently the Adams Distinguished Professor of Management, Emeritus at the Stanford Graduate School of Business, Stanford University and is a fellow of the American Market Association, Institute for Operations Research and Management Science (INFORMS) and ISMS. It is also worth noting that The American Marketing Association has established the ‘Srinivasan Young Scholar Award’ (in quantitative methodology) to be awarded annually at its Summer Conference. V. Srinivasan also received an Institute Merit Prize during the ceremony.
